intro: Chuquiraga cryptocephala, commonly known as the Andean burweed, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are surrounded by bracts, and its leaves are typically alternate and hairy. Chuquiraga cryptocephala is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for various insects and small animals.
